prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.075, 0.0] Sketch Draw a sketch on the X-Y plane of the created coordinate system: * Face 1 + Loop 1 - Line 1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: [0.75, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.1575] - Line 3: [0.75, 0.1575] to [0.735, 0.1575] - Arc 1: [0.735, 0.1575] to [0.69, 0.1125] to [0.645, 0.1575] - Line 4: [0.645, 0.1575] to [0.105, 0.1575] - Arc 2: [0.105, 0.1575] to [0.06, 0.1125] to [0.015, 0.1575] - Line 5: [0.015, 0.1575] to [0.0, 0.1575] - Line 6: [0.0, 0.1575] to [0.0, 0.0] Extrusion Extrude the sketch along the normal with the depth of 0.075, do not extrude in the opposite direction. Apply a scaling factor of 0.75 on the sketch during the extrusion. Perform a 'New Body Feature Operation' for the extrusion. Description The prism will have the following dimensions: * Shape: A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. The top and bottom sections are parallel to each other, while the middle section is slightly narrower than the top and bottom sections. The sides of the prism are straight and perpendicular to the top and bottom sections. The prism is centered in the image. * Length: 0.75 units * Width: 0.075 units * Height: 0.75 units</description>

The dimensions of the prism are approximately 2 units by 3 units by 4 units, with a length of 0.75 units, a width of 0.333 units, and a height of 0.333 units. The cylindrical hole has a diameter of approximately 1 unit, or a radius of 0.1667 units. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler Angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the Translation Vector to [0.0, 0.3333, 0.0]. Create the 2D sketch for this part. On face 1 of the sketch, create 5 lines: 1. Line 1: Draw a line segment from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.0]. 2. Line 2: Draw a line segment from point [0.75, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.5833]. 3. Line 5: Draw a line segment from point [0.0, 0.3333] to point [0.0, 0.0]. Create the second loop on face 1 of the sketch. The loop consists of a circle with the following attributes: 1. Circle 1: Draw a circle centered at point [0.3333, 0.3333] with a radius of 0.1667. Transform the 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. Set the extrude_depth_towards_normal to 0.3333 and the sketch_scale to 0.75, without any changes to extrude_depth_opposite_normal. Do not perform any boolean operation on this part. So this part will simply add material to the final model.</description>
